column1: North Port is a city located in Sarasota County
column4: 357 at the 2010 US Census. It is part of the North Port–Bradenton–Sarasota Metropolitan Statistical Area.  It was originally developed by General Development Corporation as the northern / Sarasota County portion of its Port Charlotte development
column5: the other portion located in the adjacent Charlotte County. GDC dubbed it North Port Charlotte
column6: and it was incorporated under that name through a special act of the Florida Legislature in 1959.  By referendum in 1974
column7: the city's residents approved a change to its name as North Port
column8: dropping Charlotte from its name to proclaim the city as a separate identity. It is home to the Little Salt Spring
column9: an archaeological and paleontological site owned by the University of Miami.

column1: North Port is a municipality containing large-scale residential subdivisions along with an extensive network of streets.  The municipality has annexed nearby locales including the area known as Warm Mineral Springs
column2: the location of a notable artesian spring as well as its own significant residential subdivision.

column3: of which 99.58 square miles (257.9 km2) is land and 4.58 square miles (11.9 km2) (4.40%) is water.

column3: and waste management. City Hall of North Port is located at 4970 City Hall Boulevard.

column2: North Port will be the Spring Training home for the Atlanta Braves. The Braves will also hold extended spring training in North Port.
